poem:
**A Morning's Report**

This morning's paper whispers  
of lists kept close to the chest,  
names in a ledger inked with spite,  
pages turning like the wind.  
Enemies fold like quick autumn leaves,  
each charge a rustle in the garden.  
New names scribbled,  
others crossed out—  
a script unwritten,  
yet each word heavy with intent.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Trump’s retribution campaign: who has the president targeted so far besides John Bolton? The Trump administration filed charges against former national security adviser John Bolton on Thursday, the latest target of an ongoing retribution campaign aimed at Donald Trump’s enemies. Bolton surrendered to authorities on Friday for the charges over mishandling classified materials. Bolton was the third person on Trump’s longtime enemies list to be charged by the justice department in recent weeks, an escalation". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
